title: Oil And Water
opening: Manuela and Hanneman have predictably opposite reactions to a disturbing rumor going around the monastery.

intro.speaker: Manuela
intro.line: It's raining, Professor. On rainy days, the wound I got from the Death Knight hurts like fire. Every time it aches, I get angry. You understand, yeah? I'm sure they had their reasons to kidnap Flayn, but still... Did they really need to stab me? What'd I have to do with it?! They ruined my beautiful, porcelain skin. Worse, they took off before I could stab them back. So rude.

intro.speaker: Hanneman
intro.line: That's rather enough, Manuela. Cease your moaning and give the professor a break.

intro.speaker: Manuela
intro.line: Oh, stuff it, Hanneman. Unlike you, the professor has a big heart and listens to me talk about any problem I have.

intro.speaker: Hanneman
intro.line: More likely, your incessant ramblings offer no chance to interrupt.

intro.speaker: Manuela
intro.line: Is that true, Professor?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Manuela isn't bothering me.

intro.speaker: Manuela
intro.line: I knew it. You listen to me because you care about me, don't you?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Professor Hanneman is right.

intro.speaker: Hanneman
intro.line: You heard that, didn't you, Manuela? You are bothering the professor.

intro.speaker: Manuela
intro.line: Go away, Hanneman! Leave us alone. And stop making me shout! it causes the old wound to hurt again.

intro.speaker: Hanneman
intro.line: Then perhaps you'd best stay quiet. Keep your emotions in check, I'd say.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Let's stop this now.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Let's all get along.

intro.speaker: Manuela
intro.line: Don't worry, Professor. We do this all the time.

intro.speaker: Hanneman
intro.line: Indeed, Manuela and I do not mix well. Been true for years. That said, if it were up to me, I would prefer speaking to her in a calmer manner.

intro.speaker: Manuela
intro.line: It's not like I enjoy bickering with you. So maybe keep your mouth shut more often.

intro.speaker: Hanneman
intro.line: I state that which needs to be heard! For example--

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Let's stop this now.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Let's all get along.

intro.speaker: Manuela
intro.line: I'm sorry. I couldn't help it...

intro.speaker: Hanneman
intro.line: Same, same. Apologies. I am here because I have new information on the Death Knight's hiding place.

intro.speaker: Manuela
intro.line: What? Really?! You could have started with that.

intro.speaker: Hanneman
intro.line: Several students have reported possible sightings on the western edge of the Sealed Forest. While the authenticity of these reports has yet to be verified, it is still a very real possibility. I was thinking I would report this to Seteth as a precaution.

intro.speaker: Manuela
intro.line: What? Why? We can't be slow! He's going to get away!

intro.speaker: Hanneman
intro.line: Protocol on this matter requires reporting to Seteth, then Lady Rhea, then...

intro.speaker: Manuela
intro.line: Professor, let's leave this old geezer behind and get going!

intro.speaker: Hanneman
intro.line: Old geezer? I am barely 15 years your senior! I will not hear such--

intro.speaker: Manuela
intro.line: Stop talking! Let's gather a team and get going!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I agree.

intro.speaker: Manuela
intro.line: I'll go scout ahead. I'm coming for you, Death Knight!

intro.speaker: Hanneman
intro.line: Manuela, wait! It would not do to get yourself killed without someone to avenge you!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Not yet...

intro.speaker: Manuela
intro.line: Well, I'm going ahead anyway. You can't stop me.

intro.speaker: Hanneman
intro.line: Manuela, take a moment. You must prepare before heading out! Professor, please let me know as soon as you can if you could join us.

battle.speaker: Hanneman
battle.line: Manuela's in a tough spot, Professor. Even if she's only got herself to blame, we cannot abandon her.

battle.speaker: Bandit Leader
battle.line: Heh... We have plenty of visitors today. Let's stop their annoying rescue attempt!

battle.speaker: Manuela
battle.line: Uh-oh. They've noticed me. Here they come!

battle.speaker: Thief
battle.line: Just when I decide to disguise myself as a mountain bandit and sneak in, we get attacked. Just my luck!

boss.speaker: Bandit Leader
boss.line: We are the Death God Gang! We're all unstoppable!

boss.speaker: Manuela
boss.line: Hey! You're not the Death Knight! What gives?

boss.speaker: Bandit Leader
boss.line: Death Knight? What nonsense are you talking now? Do we look like knights to you, lady?

boss.speaker: Manuela
boss.line: You're just lousy hill bandits. Well, I'll teach you to waste my time!

boss.speaker: Hanneman
boss.line: Why, there is no Death Knight here. That student's testimony was, well, it was utter bunk!

boss.speaker: Bandit Leader
boss.line: Hey, you! The weird old dude with the beard! What kinda crap are you mumbling to yourself there?

boss.speaker: Hanneman
boss.line: I beg your pardon?! Do not image you can insult me without some form of retribution!

end.speaker: Manuela
end.line: A few scrapes and bruises. But, yes, I'm well enough.

end.speaker: Manuela
end.line: How could anyone think that was the Death Knight? It was obviously just an ordinary bandit. Oh well, I may not have found my revenge, but at least we got to retrieve stolen goods.

end.speaker: Hanneman
end.line: How bloody stupid are you?! If that were the real Death Knight, you'd have new--likely fatal--wounds to match your first! Do you know how much you worried all of us? You should be ashamed!

end.speaker: Hanneman
end.line: This is a matter of life and death! It should not and must not be taken lightly!

end.speaker: Hanneman
end.line: Exactly! You are supposed to set an example for our students. Yet you let emotion get the better of you?

end.speaker: Manuela
end.line: You're right... So there, I said that. It's true, but, ugh. I'm sorry. I'll apologize to everyone later.

end.speaker: Hanneman
end.line: I should say I'm sorry as well. I lost my temper just now. I see you act so irrationally, and I lose my wits. I care about you a great deal, and wish to see you safe. Will you believe me?

end.speaker: Manuela
end.line: Yes, of course. I'm the same way, after all. I let my emotions get the best of me. We're both too old to be shouting all the time.

end.speaker: Manuela
end.line: You're awfully quick to but a bow on this. Are you sick of us already, Professor?

end.speaker: Hanneman
end.line: You're part of this, Professor. We are the only teachers this academy has. No need for bickering!

end.speaker: Manuela
end.line: Well said, Hanneman. Would you care to join me for a celebratory drink?

end.speaker: Hanneman
end.line: That sounds lovely. Perhaps a nice cup of tea is in order.
